creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: woman in 3/4 view with the front of her robe open and a dagger in her right hand pressed to her bare chest, looking away toward the right side of the picture plane
inscription:
Label

-- label on back of frame: Drawings and Watercolors from Minnesota Private Collections  / L71.83.1 / catalogue no. 3. Giovanni Francesco Barbieri (called Guercino) \"Lucretia\" 1923 / The Minneapolis Institute of Arts May 13-June 13, 1971

-- in graphite on back of backing sheet, upper left: C POA L O/S
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn., at least by 1971; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Lucretia
